intro: Pleuranthodium sagittatum, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It is often found growing along riverbanks and in wetlands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
